back_cards.definition_en: Used to negate a verb or statement.
back_cards.example_en: She is not coming to the party.
I will not eat that spicy soup.
Do not touch the hot stove.
There is not enough time today.
Is it not true that you were late?
I wanted to go, but it rained.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows an exception to a statement.
back_cards.example_en: Everyone was there but Sarah.
It’s nice, but too expensive.
She fell but got up quickly.
He’s young but very skilled.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to multiple people or things.
back_cards.example_en: They are playing in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for a group previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: The books are here; they are new.
They say it will snow tomorrow.
They forgot their homework.
They could win if they try.
She said she loves hiking.
He says the meeting is at noon.
The sign says to keep out.
Her smile says she’s happy.
They said it was a great movie.
Meet me at the coffee shop.
The movie starts at 7 p.m.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows a point of focus or target.
back_cards.example_en: She pointed at the map.
He’s great at fixing cars.
Apples are sold at $2 per pound.

Juno.definition_en: Used to ask about something unknown.

Juno.example_en: Tell me what you want to do.

back_cards.example_en: His dog ran away yesterday.
I borrowed his pencil.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in relation to a male’s role.
back_cards.example_en: His job is very demanding.
His sister called earlier.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a male’s work or creation.
back_cards.example_en: His painting is on display.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates the starting point or origin.
back_cards.example_en: I got a letter from Jane.
Take the toys from the floor.
She’s tired from the long hike.
The shop is open from 9 a.m.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows origin of a person or thing.
back_cards.example_en: This wine is from Italy.
Let’s go to the zoo today.
The train goes in five minutes.
The meeting will go on late.
My watch doesn’t go anymore.
This path goes to the lake.
Would you like tea or coffee?
Hurry up, or we’ll be late.
You can call or text me.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows an exception in negative sentences.
back_cards.example_en: I don’t drink tea or coffee.
It’s a bear, or a large animal.
She traveled by bus.
The store is by the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Denotes the agent of an action.
back_cards.example_en: The book was written by him.
Finish it by tomorrow.
She won by a small margin.
I got a gift for my birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrive or reach a place.
back_cards.example_en: We got to the beach early.
I get what you’re saying.

back_cards.definition_en: To become or start to be.
back_cards.example_en: It’s getting dark outside.
Can you get me some water?
She is reading a book.
Her bag is on the chair.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in a narrative about a female.
back_cards.example_en: She won the race yesterday.
She is the team captain.
If she calls, let me know.
My car is parked outside.
My phone is brand new.
My brother is coming over.
My goodness, it’s cold!
My project is almost done.
I can run a mile in six minutes.
You can use my laptop.
It can snow this evening.
Can you help me with this?
She can speak three languages.
She works as a nurse.
He’s as tall as a tree.
She read as she ate breakfast.
As it’s late, we should go.
Do as you’re told.
I know the answer to the question.
She knows the mayor personally.
He knows how to fix cars.
I know that song from somewhere.
They know the city’s history.
I’ll stay if you want me to.
I wonder if she’ll come.
If I were rich, I’d travel.
If you could help, I’d appreciate it.
If it rains, we’ll cancel.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker as an object.
back_cards.example_en: She gave me a book.
He sat next to me.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates the speaker in an action.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher called me.
I bought myself a coffee.
My friend invited me over.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows possession by the person addressed.
back_cards.example_en: Your bag is on the table.
Is this your phone?
Your opinion is important.
Your sister called earlier.
Your health matters a lot.
